meanings.definition: To make a sound expressing disapproval or disagreement.
meanings.sent1: The child ouk loudly when told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent2: She always ouks when her brother tries to take her toys.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to ouk at the idea of taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm ouked angrily in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The old door ouked in protest as it swung on its rusty hinges.

meanings.sent1: His constant ouk to any suggestion was frustrating.
meanings.sent2: The teacher received an ouk from the student when assigning homework.
meanings.sent3: The dog's loud ouk to going outside made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky were like a silent ouk to the picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The loudspeaker's sudden ouk interrupted the peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A Scottish term for an oak tree.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ouk stood tall in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent2: The leaves of the ouk rustled in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel climbed the ouk to reach its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The ouk's branches reached out like welcoming arms.
meanings.sent5: The ouk's roots delved deep into the earth for nourishment.
